member.summary: Specifies how date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DateParseHandling.None
member.summary: Date formatted strings are not parsed to a date type and are read as strings.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTime
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DateParseHandling.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Date formatted strings, e.g. "\/Date(1198908717056)\/" and "2012-03-21T05:40Z", are parsed to .

member.name: T:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling
member.summary: Specifies how to treat the time value when converting between string and .

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Local
member.summary: Treat as local time. If the object represents a Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), it is converted to the local time.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Utc
member.summary: Treat as a UTC. If the object represents a local time, it is converted to a UTC.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.Unspecified
member.summary: Treat as a local time if a is being converted to a string. If a string is being converted to , convert to a local time if a time zone is specified.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DateTimeZoneHandling.RoundtripKind
member.summary: Time zone information should be preserved when converting.

member.name: T:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: T:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.FloatFormatHandling
member.summary: Specifies float format handling options when writing special floating point numbers, e.g. , and with .

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.FloatFormatHandling.String
member.summary: Write special floating point values as strings in JSON, e.g. "NaN", "Infinity", "-Infinity".

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.FloatFormatHandling.Symbol
member.summary: Write special floating point values as symbols in JSON, e.g. NaN, Infinity, -Infinity. Note that this will produce non-valid JSON.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.FloatFormatHandling.DefaultValue
member.summary: Write special floating point values as the property's default value in JSON, e.g. 0.0 for a property, null for a property.

member.name: T:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.FloatParseHandling
member.summary: Specifies how floating point numbers, e.g. 1.0 and 9.9, are parsed when reading JSON text.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.FloatParseHandling.Double
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.FloatParseHandling.Decimal
member.summary: Floating point numbers are parsed to .

member.summary: Specifies the member serialization options for the .

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.MemberSerialization.OptOut
member.summary: All public members are serialized by default. Members can be excluded using or . This is the default member serialization mode.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.MemberSerialization.OptIn
member.summary: Only members must be marked with or are serialized. This member serialization mode can also be set by marking the class with .

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.MemberSerialization.Fields
member.summary: All public and private fields are serialized. Members can be excluded using or . This member serialization mode can also be set by marking the class with and setting IgnoreSerializableAttribute on to false.

member.summary: Read metadata properties located at the start of a JSON object.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.MetadataPropertyHandling.ReadAhead
member.summary: Read metadata properties located anywhere in a JSON object. Note that this setting will impact performance.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.MetadataPropertyHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Do not try to read metadata properties.

member.summary: Ignore a missing member and do not attempt to deserialize it.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.NullValueHandling.Ignore

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.ObjectCreationHandling.Auto
member.summary: Reuse existing objects, create new objects when needed.

member.summary: Only reuse existing objects.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.ObjectCreationHandling.Replace
member.summary: Always create new objects.

member.summary: Preserve references when serializing into a JSON array structure.

member.name: F:Stimulsoft.Base.Json.PreserveReferencesHandling.All
